reviews.review_msg: Steve was a great professor who was very entertaining and really cared for his students. He answers email even on weekends and truly attends to his students. Lecture was heavily based on what he says in class rather than slides and textbooks but he makes lectures entertaining and enjoying. Makes great humour in class.

You know, I bet you're scrolling through these reviews, thinking "god I should avoid Steve." However, if you have a sense of humor, and enjoy interesting people, then I would definitely recommend Steve. It's an experience you can't get with any other professor: he tells jokes all class and truly knows his material. Also you don't need the textbook.

Steve is entertaining but rude. Tough grader, the assignments don't have a grading rubric which makes it extra confusing. The book and slides don't reflect what he's teaching in class, but if you pay attention, the assignments are not that hard.
Group assignments were very confusing, counted for a large portion of your grade. Hard marker.

He encourages you to go to office hours to ask for help on the assignments, yet he is ZERO help. He is also VERY unclear as to what he expects from your paper. Not to mention he is very ignorant and opinionated. He also sends DOZENS of emails on a weekly basis that are not even mandatory to read for the exam assignments.
Worst instructor I had at SFU. I could've taught this class better than her because she doesn't understand the material herself.

She has been one of my favorite professors at SFU. She calls on students but it keeps you engaged. She has an immense amount of real world experience and give a lot of consumer behviour examples from her experiences. If you put in the effort, this class pays off with Dr. Z.
